It’s like this for most alt coins. Bitcoin is the leader. Nobody knows for sure if it will remain the leader, or what will dethrone it or when. We all hedge our positions accordingly. I’m a huge supporter of XRP, but I also hold Bitcoin and BitcoinCash.

I like to be the reminder that XRP can do whatever any other crypto can do. It doesn’t help to pigeonhole it as a “banker’s coin,” IMO. Especially when so many amateur reporters are quick to report that they spoke to a banker who never heard of XRP blah blah blah.
I was expressing my personal opinion. I’m not a Ripple employee.
Ripple never promised the world I would care whether or not banks use XRP. Anybody can use XRP however they like.
XRP can do what any other crypto can do. I don’t have to care about who else is using it and for what.
What a PIA! Seriously. Imagine trying to explain that to somebody who has never owned Bitcoin.
Ripple is a private company whose shares you cannot own.
It’s a multi-asset wallet that allows you to hold your own coins. It’s risky to leave crypto on an exchange.
Alts usually follow whatever Bitcoin does, but they often fall faster and gain slower.

If you're going to run a Bitcoin node on a @Raspberry_Pi , I advise against using a microSD card for the data storage. In my experience they tend to degrade after a ~year of read & write operations & your node will crash trying to read corrupt data. Use an external SSD instead.
